results.title: Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind
results.creator_credit: Focus Features, Steve Golin, Anthony Bregman and Michel Gondry
results.brief_description: Joel (Jim Carrey) and Clementine’s (Kate Winslet) relationship isn’t going too well so she engages a psychiatrist to employ a process whereby Joel and the relationship is erased from her memory. On finding out about the procedure Joel thinks he’ll do the same but the couple actually re-discover more about the start of their relationship and what brought them together in the first place. In a quirky look at relationships, break-ups and a kind of love-conquers-all mystique this romantic/black comedy stems from the same key team that put together “Human Nature” - director Michel Gondry and writer Charlie Kaufman. Cast includes Kirsten Dunst, Mark Ruffalo, Elijah Wood, Tom Wilkinson.

results.title: Eternal France
results.creator_credit: Kageneck Video, James R. Conner and August von Kageneck
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
From the Roman ruins in Provence to Napoleon’s Arc de Triomphe in Paris, the rich history and culture of France awaits you. Wander inside the majestic Cathedrals of Reims and Chartres. Watch the artistry of glass-makers in Baccarat, the lacemakers in the Auvergne and silk painters in Lyon. Then, marvel at the beauty and mystery of Brittany’s stunning abbey of Mont-Saint-Michel.

results.title: Eternal children
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Don Haldane
results.brief_description: Children who through heredity, brain injury or various other causes are not equipped to keep pace in a competitive world - are they to be society’s unwitting castaways? This film gives a frank appraisal of the problem and shows methods of care and training being developed in special schools and institutions for the mentally disabled. (Awards: Columbus; New York)

results.title: Eternal change: story of a mountain
results.brief_description: Traces the origin of Mount Rainier from eruption through a rift in the surface and its development in subsequent volcanic action. Shows the cycle of the seasons, the erosion by wind and water, the action of snow and ice and the movement of the glaciers.
results.description: Traces the origin of Mount Rainier from eruption through a rift in the surface and its development in subsequent volcanic action. Shows the cycle of the seasons, the erosion by wind and water, the action of snow and ice and the movement of the glaciers.

results.title: Et la Terre Fut ...
results.brief_description:
Episode 1 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This first episode deals with the formation of the Earth and the apparition of life on Earth with the amphibians and other prehistorical animals. This episode also covers the evolution of primates, the domestication of fire and the development of hunting techniques.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Et cetera. Season 2. Episode 7 [The State Library. Melbourne Cup handover. Tumbarumba]
results.brief_description:
Northern Access Television produced this episode of the
series “Et cetera” featuring a visit to the State Library of
Victoria and an interview with Melinda Dundas - Public
Affairs Officer, who talks of the services available to
residents and tourists, and multicultural, regional and youth oriented initiatives. Interviewer Suzana Talevski
also speaks to Librarian Des Cawley. Justine Isard reports
from the Windsor Hotel where the handover of the Melbourne Cup by the Hardy Brothers to the Victorian Racing Club (VRC) is taking place. Includes footage of the cup’s production. Phillip Taylor speaks to percussion group
Tumbarumba. Presented by David McLauchlan.

results.title: Esty Deez
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Health, Sabina Wynn and Tom McPartland
results.brief_description: A frank look at the importance of using condoms to prevent sexually transmited diseases. Discusses the dangers of having multiple sexual partners and what should be done if an STD is contracted. Depicts the behaviour of adolescents together with contemporary language to ensure the attention of the intended audience. NB: TEACHER PREVIEW PRIOR TO CLASSROOM VIEWING IS RECOMMENDED.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New South Wales. Dept. of Health, Sabina Wynn and Tom McPartland

results.title: Estuary
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Vancouver Motion Pictures, Peter Jones, John Taylor and Don White
results.brief_description: Perhaps because estuaries seem so ordinary, many on the west coast of Canada are being drained to accommodate new housing and industry. This film demonstrates the importance of the estuary; its environmental function, the natural forces that control it, and its particular ecology. Superb microphotography affords unusual shots of tiny creatures hunting and eating their prey. Sound by John Knight. (Five awards, including Toronto; San Antonio)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Vancouver Motion Pictures, Peter Jones, John Taylor and Don White

results.title: Estuary
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray, John Shaw and Greg Reading
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Features the plants (mangroves) and animals living in a tidal estuary at Port Stevens, Sydney. Discusses the habitat problems of tidal movement and salinity in fresh water. Narrated by Robin Williams.
